Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was severely run down, the phone's didn't work, the windows wouldn't lock, noisy, hotel room had a foul odor, electrical outlets hanging out of wall, sheets were stained, porn on t.v., only 1 washcloth in bathroom. Breakfast was bread and cereal.Hotel staff was incompetent. Had booked for 4 nights, checked out the next morning. This place should be condemned!

Reviews.Title: “Choice Hotels Should Be Ashamed”
Reviews.Author: tish804
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst hotels I've been in my life. The bed had springs sticking you in your back, and it made squeaking noises everytime you turn....We were in a room with one bed and the bed was a twin bed......The carpet was filthy. The towels were dirty, and they had hair sticking out of them....The towels had stains all over them.....i didn't even take a shower there my husband and I just washed our faces, brushed our teeth, and got out of there as fast as possible when daylight hit.....I checked the bed to make sure there were no bedbugs, because the room looked like bedbugs could be hidden somewhere in there, and although I didn't get bitten by bedbugs I did see a roach crawling in the bathroom. If you read this review don't stay at this hotel it is horrible. I booked this room from Choice Rewards, and this hotel should be removed from their list....This hotel is not up to their standards.....and the pictures they show don't look anything like the room I stayed in.....

Reviews.Title: “park and cruise”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel. When we arrived there was no hot water in the room. The management rectified the problem quickly. Next morning no hot water again but again one phone call fixed it quickly. Bed was very good. Ride to cruise terminal was fine. Driver arrived at the port for pick up at the time requested. Our car was parked behind the office and was fine when we returned from the trip. If you are looking for a budget park and cruise stay this place is very basic but for one night it works.

Reviews.Title: “Expedient but not recommended”
Reviews.Author: rayzel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because they had a park and cruise deal and the price was better than any other hotel in the area. When we arrived, we almost did not stay, but we thought it would work for one night. We had asked for a room with an interior location and they did accommodate us. However, although quite pleasant, the people at the front desk were unable to offer restaurant recommendations or much other area advice. The only place to eat in the area was in a strip mall nearby. There was a Walmart up the road, so we were able to pick up a few last minute items for our trip. It was quite cold outside when we stayed and we found, to our dismay, that the bathroom was not heated at all. Also, I let the water run for a considerable amount of time, but it was stone cold. On the bright side, the bed was comfortable and the WiFi worked well. They did have one computer in the tiny lobby as well. However, it was out in the open with absolutely no privacy. The room includes breakfast which was allegedly served from 7:30 to 9:30AM. When we went down at 9:10, they were out of everything from milk to coffee to sweetner to waffles. Someone brought down some milk, but my husband drank cold coffee and I couldn't have tea because I cannot use sugar and there was nothing else. We have stayed in many "budget" hotels that serve breakfast and this was, by far, the absolute worst. Our rolls, coffee and croissants at a 2 star Paris hotel were better than what this hotel offered. We would have gone elsewhere to eat, but we were headed to a cruise ship and knew we would have a large lunch. Included in our rate was parking for the cruise duration as well as transportation to and from the airport. They were very accommodating regarding the time we wanted to leave and we were driven in a private mini-van. The driver said he had taken others to the port and knew the way. He took the route on city streets rather than the highway in order to save his boss the tolls which was fine because there was absolutely no traffic that day. However, he took us to the Inner Harbor, not the cruise terminal and did not know how to get to the terminal. He stopped at a grocery store to ask directions, but they did not know where to go. Finally, we asked him to stop at a hotel which he did. There was a taxi driver there and she drew him a map and we made our way to the terminal. A 15-20 minute trip took over an hour. Fortunately we had plenty of time, but if we were running late, it would have been nerve-wracking! When it came time for pick-up, I gave the driver the exact address of the terminal so he could put it into his GPS and he arrived in short order. He took the highway back to hotel so it was a quick trip. Hopefully he will now know where to go if other cruisers stay at this hotel. He said they just started offering the stay and cruise package so that was why he was unfamiliar with the port area. Our car was well-watched and just as we left it directly behind the hotel office out of view of the highway. I was a little concerned because fellow passengers told us the hotel was not in the best of neighborhoods. We were not familiar with Baltimore so we did not know this in advance. Bottom line, this is a basic hotel that can work for a single night, but for a few dollars more, there are probably nicer places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fast and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sung L
Reviews.Content: Wow! Fast and quick checkin and checkout! Great service with free parking and very close (10 -15 min.) to Inner Harbor. Quiet room much appreciated after partying all night New Year's Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Update to my earlier review”
Reviews.Author: lbdmt
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was satisfied with my stay at this hotel. But I must say I was disappointed later. I happened to have left my very expensive jacket and when I called to ask if it had been found, the manager told me that 'everything left is thrown out'. Right..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jack D
Reviews.Content: With my plane touching down at BWI after nearly 6 hrs of delay at Heathrow, all I wanted to do was sleep. Having booked a suite at Rodeway Inn Midtown before leaving Brussels, I was more or less expecting a nice and decent room. Rodeway Inn Midtown surpasses my expectation. The strategic location of the hotel as well as the friendliness of the staff was world class. I was able to hop on and off the Charm City Circulator absolutely free! The continental breakfast served in the morning and the steaming hot waffles kept my going for the early part of the day. Who said you cant have a business trip at a budget cost. I will surely stay at Rodeway Inn when next I visit B'more.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Gilbert B
Reviews.Content: When I got in the first room they gave me I realized that the smoke detector was keeping beeping.The second room had a problem with the door and I had to call someone to open it everytime I want to enter my room.The third room they gave me had a problem with the water flushing system.In addition,the Front Desk smells awful,the towels are dirty and the staff are nonprofessional.They also tell you they offer deluxe breakfast.In fact,it's a very poor one and everyday I noticed there was someting missing:the milk or the hot water... It's a terrible place,I won't never go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Embarrassing”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellers888
Reviews.Content: First off the room stank of urine, the floors were grimy, and the walls were paper thin. To make matters worse, a housekeeper walked in on my husband and I in a rather intimate setting. That was the last straw and we decided to leave. When told about the issue, the desk clerk refused to let us speak to the manager and still charged us for that night. We have never encountered worse customer service and poor accommodations. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST MOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: owenmcg
Reviews.Content: Worst Motel I have ever stayed in. Closet size rooms, Dirty, Threadbare Towels, Walls so thin I could listen to conversations in next room . 1980'S TV

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: santos h
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I was passing through Baltimore. At first, I did not think the hotel was very nice. But after I stayed there, I thought is unfair if I don't write about this hotel. Very nice and helpful staffs, great service, nice and clean room and free continental breakfast to start your day with. I also travel and use internet a lot. The free high speed WIFI was like a bonus. I recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: AGBONGA
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much for the level of excellent rooms and services. And I especially thank the receptionist, who attends daily in the period from 11 am to eight in the morning, but I do not remember his name...

Reviews.Title: “....Great sense of service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunn_001
Reviews.Content: A warm thanks to all the staff of rodeway inn.you guys really make my stay in balto sensational. Pretty room, nice and clean. I appreciate the kindness of the FDC and his conductibility.Welcome every request with smile...I enjoy being with u.Keep it that way!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE: Staff will steal your money by overcharging you!!!”
Reviews.Author: smoten
Reviews.Content: First let me say that i am a former employee of choice hotels so i know the inside scoop on what is right and what is wrong. Before going to this hotel, i checked their rates on the website. Rate stated $59.99. When i arrived, the desk clerk told me the rate was $79.99 for the basic single room. When i explained that i knew the correct rate was $59.99 he tried his hardest to convince me that the website was wrong and that $80 is their "weekend rate". Once i told him i was a former corporate employee he gave a slick grin and reduced his quoted rate to the correct rate. BUT he tried to charge me $20 in tax and again asking for $80 EVEN. I quickly calculated and told him that with tax the total should be $67.09. Then he told me that they round it up to $80 and use the remaining $12.91 as a deposit... REALLY??? Are you serious? Oh but it gets better. I gave in and handed the clerk $80 and asked for a receipt. Wouldn't you know he had one more crazy story for me. He said that the do not give receipts until the next day at check out, even for cash paying customers... Of course i know this to be a lie as again, im in the business but i didn't feel like battling this rude person anymore, i kindly took my money back from his hands and told him I would go somewhere else. I immediately went to my car, sat in the parking lot and called choice hotels to complain. Customer service apologized for his rude behavior and repeated lies and emailed me a statement to receive a free night at a choice hotel property of my choice. DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE POSITIVE RATINGS ON HERE. ITS MORE THAN LIKELY THAT THE STAFF IS POSTING THEM TO MAKE THEM LOOK GOOD....

Reviews.Title: “this was an incredible experience in baltimore...”
Reviews.Author: emon_u2000
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot to rode way inn & suites. your fabulous room service,interior and customer service was magnificent. all the staffs were very professional and humble (manager was the best). and thanks for that amazing luxurious room...best place to be....

Reviews.Title: “My second stay topped the first!!!”
Reviews.Author: BronxBella
Reviews.Content: Kumar and Rookman were excellent!!! I love those guys!!! Customer satisfaction GUARANTEED!!! Even when under pressure they smile joke and have a good time. Courtesy and respect are understatements! I won't stay ANYPLACE else....UNLEESS they run the place (smile).....This New YorkGirl has found a home awayfrom home!!! Sukriya!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the negative reviews !!”
Reviews.Author: enaudnella
Reviews.Content: I almost overlooked a gem after reading all the negative reviews. I checked in late and I was given an upgrade until they found another standard room the next day. The manager walked me to the room and was extremely polite, respectful and waived any late check in fees......The front desk guy was just as polite every time I went to the desk. One time the key did not work, but I took it up front and no problem with re-activating it quickly. Rooms cleaned and new towels given every day. Breakfast is decent. Off the Hwy so a little noise if you are in front , but not a major issue. On the weekend there is a club across the street , I never saw or heard anything to affect safety or opinion of the property. Not fancy , but decent moderate clean hotel at great rates and not far from Harbor area and you can pull up to your room at no cost!

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome From Start to Finish@Rodeway”
Reviews.Author: Tiraflecha
Reviews.Content: The entire staff of Rodeway is a great team of down to earth professionals. I was greeted by Aastha, a down to earth front desk attendant. She recommended a great Indian restaurant in my travels downtown to catch John Legend And Sade Concert at 1st Mariner Arena in Baltimore, In addition upon my late evening arrival Kumar welcome me with a warm smile. Off to my king size bed (bst sleep I ever got traveling) bed was comfy I woke up thinking I was at home on my memory foam mattress. The breakfast the next day hit the spot. The housekeeping staff was polite, also met Shawn who has a ever present smile on his face. The staff enjoy working at Rodeway Inn and it shows by their warm demeonor. To top it off can't beat the value for a clean, cosy room with large bathroom,, fridge, cable tv, free wifi in room. and cold AC, recommend it in your travels in Baltimore Area. Albert El Tiraflecha Dominguez

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: jk75107
Reviews.Content: When we walked into Rodeway Inn & Suites, we were greeted by the first friendly face we had seen all night. After driving hours upon end...JT (General Manager) showed us to our room, the cleanest room I have ever walked into. He truly saved our vacation from heading in the wrong direction. Rodeway Inn & Suites clearly know the definition of hospitality.Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible nightmare”
Reviews.Author: hoppa1177
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say the staff is very friendly. We were shown to our room. It was clean but very small. When we opened the door the door hit the bed so tells you how tiny it is. It had a very odd smell to the room. My kids went to turn on the bedside lamp and desk lamps and they didn't turn on. The overhead light was an annoying fluorescent light. Then my son decided to watch some tv while I was trying to figure out how to get to where we were going. The tv didn't work...why?? Because they unplug every thing in the room. We had to crawl under the desk to plug all cords in. The desk chair felt wet and slimy and the cords were greasy as well. My son sat in chair to watch tv ( not desk chair) and said it felt wet and weird as well. I have a special needs child and he didn't feel comfortable here at all. He was paranoid that smoke detector was sitting on the floor with NO battery. Went we went to bed the traffic from the busy highway was so loud I sat and looked at the wall all night. Had less than 3 hrs. I will say the beds were comfortable. Took shower the next morning in the huge bathroom and whatever they clean the floors with is some seriously heavy duty wax. I warned my boys about it because even with standing on towels they slid out from under you. My poor 12 yr old lost balance and came within inches of busting his head off sink. Breakfast was decent I liked the fact you could make your own belgian waffles. I got excited when I saw fresh fruit till I realized it was dusty wax decoration. The floors in the room where food is as well was so waxy that the chair slid while sitting in it. The price was great but I could have paid $20 more and stayed somewhere much nicer. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: felrona
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel a week ahead of time knowing we wanted to explore the Baltimore Maryland. Upon arrival we were told the cable was out and needed to have our room changed from a room with a King bed to a room with a double bed, we paid the same price. Once we got to the room the lamp didnt work while checking it out the outlet had no cover and the socket itself was hanging from the wall! To make matters worse the fire alarm was disarmed and placed in the side drawer. After we called the front desk they didn't even knock on the door they just barged in. When I went to take a shower the water was BROWN I had to let it run for several minutes before it became clear. When we returned from a day in the city, we found black curly hair in the bath-tub; my hair is striaght blond my boyfriend shaves his head no reason for there to be black hair in our tub unless someone else took a shower there. There was also soap on top of the shower ledge that neither of us use. While brushing teeth we heard a scratching sound in the wall, we decided that the neighbor possibly had a dog. That is until we we were sleeping and heard the same scratching sound in the ceiling above us. I called to complain and the hotel was supposed to call me back and they have yet to call. I would not go to this hotel ever again nore would I suggest people to go there. It was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Leisure_11
Reviews.Content: I visited the Rodeway Inn at Baltimore and Richmond. The hotel has comforatable rooms and a very friendly and nice staff. They took care of each n every thing that was / will be required during and after the travel. My rating for this hotel is 200/100. Must stay here, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I never even got to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MonaCK
Reviews.Content: So... I booked this hotel last minute. I booked this hotel mostly on the recommendation of fellow travelers here on TripAdvisor. I just wanted a place to throw my head at night that was clean and safe. I arrived at the hotel at approximately 2:30pm today. I waited patiently in line while others were checked in in front of me. The woman who was directly in front of me had a complaint about her room. She said it smelled of sewage, and asked for another room. the front desk clerk gave her a very hard time about it, but finally gave in. I walked up after, and thought I would joke about it, and said: Please don't give me the room that she just checked out of. Well... this caused the front desk clerk to explode.. I mean EXPLODE. he started screaming at -me- about the woman who had been there before me - someone who I had never met, and have absolutely no association with. I just asked him to please finish checking me in, that I didn't want any problems, and I just wanted to go lay down and take a nap before my event tonight. At that point, he was about to give me the keys. He took the key back, told me that he was cancelling my room, and to get the hell out of his hotel. So I left. And I booked a Hyatt Place that I should have booked to begin with. Buyer beware. Do your homework. Don't believe the hype. DO. NOT. BOOK. HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigMatt23
Reviews.Content: Value was awesome! Working in the area, and I stayed here for four days. I'm working 2nd shift so I sleep most of the morning. This was the quietist motel I've ever stayed in. But the best thing about this motel is the staff. They will go out of their way to make you happy.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and dirty at the Rodeway Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kerplode
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that check-in was easy and the room was large, but the room was freezing and stayed freezing for a few hours. I was wearing my jacket for over 2 hours in the room, and I still wasn't comfortable. My husband wore his for over an hour. The bathroom floor was sticky, hair on the sheets, no handtowels or cloths were provided (they were delivered after a request was made), the floor around the bathroom appeared stained with (well, you know), and the fridge wouldn't cool anything. Since it wasn't working, we wanted ice, but they charge for ice. Seriously? Free breakfast, but they charge for ice?!? The motel has rooms with outside access. You can park right in front of the room, which is nice, but I really don't like motels. This place is fine for guys, but I don't recommend it for ladies. It might be better in warm weather.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwilkes
Reviews.Content: we stay at choice hotels often and this one is wonderful. the staff was the best part as they are friendly and helpful, they even gave us mapquest directions to where we wanted to go. It was a good location for us as our son lives close by and getting downtown was very close and simple maybe 10- 15 mins. Also a good breakfast with more than just coffee and rolls. We will stay there again in december.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Villasanborja A
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week and place is excelent and quiet clean and enjoyed the location no annoying noises and therar plenty of free parking. Harbour and baltimore downtown is close and not traffic at all. So I high recommened it for everybody especially for families because I had very nice time there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent homely facility”
Reviews.Author: GONASAPasadena
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the stay here. Employees were very friendly and helpful. They made me feel like I was at home. One thing I would like to recommend is that they should have restaurant listing for the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while on wheels”
Reviews.Author: Mike_PA123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 1 night stay at this wonderful hotel. We were looking for a place to stay while coming back from DC. My GPS showed this place and we just walk in. The staff of this hotel were as friendly and accomodating as any place we have ever stayed. The entire property was spotless. Kudos to the management... The room and bathrooms are extra clean. We will definately be back while another trip to DC in next month.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: sndas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place because of the medical needs of our family member in John Hopkins Hospital. Friendly staff and manager gave us complementary ride to the hospital. The place is very reasonable but one suggestion: Need shuttle service to the hospitals. airport and nearby. I will be back again sometimes next month and stay here. Hope they will have shuttle service for me. Thanks and good luck.

Reviews.Title: “palacious staying experience”
Reviews.Author: johne_9
Reviews.Content: I experienced one of the best staying experience at Regal Inn and Suites,at Baltimore during my last visit to USA. THE ROOMS ARE REAL GOOD WITH LOTS OF FACILITIES AND HAVING VERY VERY CORDIAL STAFF AVAILABLE ALL THE TIME. I was having a dream that at some point of time I should have the experience of how the Ex-Ruler were staying in their Palace during their regime as King.I must admit that the experience of my recent stay was equally of the kind which I was having the dream. I would never like to miss the opportunity of staying at the Regal Inn where ever possible. I would very strongly recommend all my friends to stay at the Regal Inn. I wish all the Best to the team of Regal Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean Motel With Cheap Price Ranges in the Area!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bhuyan
Reviews.Content: I was there in Baltimore for my business purpose with my colleagues..We were looking for a nice place which can fit into our budget...We found this motel meeting all our needs...They provides refrigerator in the rooms..Nice and clean rooms...daily room service and free internet service...Last but the most important the price ranges are quite cheap compare to some hotel in the area....15-20 mins from baltimore downtown...Hotel is managed by one family...this family maintain this motel pretty good..Definetley recommand this motel..

Reviews.Title: “This Place Needs Fixin”
Reviews.Author: mizzbusiness
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Regal Inn on Pulaski Hwy.I've stayed at different spots in Baltimore,but saw an Advertising for Jacuzzi Rooms and decided to book here to enjoy some Jacuzzi time.At. check in,there was alot of Construction on the premises,which made my check- in very loud.I asked about the kinds of rooms available.The Indian front desk woman gave me 5 keys to look at some rooms and to decide for myself.The rooms were very similar,but there were things missing from the room.Like 1 room would have a frig and no microwave,the other would have a microwave and no frig.None of them had closet space(Irealized when I settled in My room).I chose room 303.It costed Me $120 plus $5 for the key and $5 for the phone(just in case).I had to place My luggage in a corner of the room.It had a Jacuzzi,mirrored celings,tv(with no remote and no prongs on tv,to connect My own DVD player)frig and Microwave,just not enough light sockets to have them plugged at the same time.The tv,microwave and frig were rotating the closest socket,so it was either or.If the tv and frig were plugged,I had to unplug the tv for the microwave..I turned on the shower.The tub floor was Gross.The whole bathroom got wet with water perspiration.The mirror stayed wet,the sink,the floors,the toilet..It was uncomfortable to be in.I wore flip flops the entire time.The carpet was creepy.The Jacuzzi had Large Cracks in the structure.A rubber Sink Stopper as what held water in and u can lift it to let water out.I noticed that the mirrored ceiling had cracks in it.The next day,I awoke a little late and needed a 1hr extension.The front desk lady informed Me that it is an extra $10.LoL**I got the H*ll out o there**The room was ok,if You wanna take some pictures in the Jacuzzi,or go and drink and smoke,have quick [--],but not if You'd like to get Truly comfortable and enjoy Your stay..

Reviews.Title: “Caught scabies, tinnea pedis”
Reviews.Author: Gulliver69
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this very inexpensive motel several times. During the holiday, December 2007, we booked a week. A couple days after we went home, my friend and I began developing lesions beginning with our feet and progressing throughout our bodies. We went to the hospital where they diagnosed the parasites as scabies (contagious itch or mange especially with exudative crusts that is caused by parasitic mites), together with tinnea pedius (athletes foot). We returned to the manager of the motel to notify her that the room had parasites, and to request a refund to defray medical costs. She refused, saying that we had no proof that the documented parasites were contracted there. (Coincidentally, however, staff at the motel did acknowledge that the room we had was now closed for “repairs”). The parasites are extremely annoying, not to mention embarrassing. I wonder how many others were infected before they closed the room. If denial was not management’s first response, I wonder if my friend and I might have been spared this pain and embarrassment. Management must have received other complaints before ours to prompt the room closure. Fortunately my friend and I have no spouses to have to explain this to. I wonder how many others who have been infected have been as fortunate.

Reviews.Title: “Just 4 Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Regal Hotel is a low budget motel that is in itself, beautiful. It may not have a luxurious bath or a big King size bed, but it serves its purpose for sleep and most importantly ---!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 8005 Pulaski Highway, Baltimore, MD 21237
